unit_learning_outcomes.description: Reflect on learning experience to inform future academic, disciplinary and professional practice.
Produce written and multimodal texts appropriate to the purpose and audience in accordance with academic, disciplinary and professional communication conventions.
Understand the basic grammatical foundations of clear academic and professional communication.
Critically gather, read, interpret, evaluate and synthesise information and ideas from appropriate sources.
Demonstrate acceptable academic practices, behaviours and values (academic integrity) in the completion of assessment tasks and other learning activities.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Completing set readings for the Unit.

enrolment_rules.description: ACBE100, ACSC100, CAPP100, WACB100, WACS100, ACSH100, WACH100

assessments.description: Students are required to write a professional email to their manager listing the available options to the scenario on which they presented for the Presentation (Working group) task and recommend a final solution.
Students will be required to complete a variety of tasks in class and to engage in online discussions.

The Persuasive Essay requires students to identify a recommendation in response to the social issue on which they focused in the Integrative Summary. Students should provide a central thesis to argue for the recommendation they will put forward. Students show draw information from a  minimum of five sources .

After receiving peer and teacher feedback, students will be required to submit the draft of the Integrative Summary during their scheduled class time to the Turnitin submission link provided on iLearn.

Students are divided into their social inclusion topics and given a scenario that could occur in the workplace environment. They discuss the options, choose a final solution and present it to the class.
After receiving peer and teacher review, students are required to submit the draft of the Persuasive Essay during their scheduled class time to the Turnitin submission link provided on iLearn.

In  this assessment task students will be required to synthesise information and varying perspectives on a certain aspect of an assigned social issue based on evidence presented in two given sources. Based on  the Match Overview report on their first submission, students are also required to submit a reflection on how they avoided / addressed plagiarism in their writing.

data.description: This unit is designed to support students in their transition to university by enabling them to understand and achieve standards of performance required in an academic environment. The unit provides a three-level focus which is initiated by supporting the development of academic practices, behaviours and values. Secondly, it fosters a level of familiarity with the disciplinary language, texts and conventions used when studying in programs offered by the Faculty of Arts. Finally, it raises an awareness of the diverse perspectives offered by disciplines and the different contributions they can make to solving problems and addressing issues of concern in contemporary society. Learning and assessment activities are designed to build the capacity for independent and collaborative approaches to learning. Students are guided to develop their capacity for reading, thinking and expressing ideas effectively and critically.
